thread.title_full: Game Of Thrones Star Neil Fingleton Dead At 36 From Heart Failure | PerezHilton.com

title: Game Of Thrones Star Neil Fingleton Dead At 36 From Heart Failure | PerezHilton.com
text:
2/26/2017 11:33 AM ET | Filed under: TV News • Anglophilia • R.I.P. • Sad Sad • Health • Basketball • Game Of Thrones 
More very sad news to wake up to this morning… 
After reporting on the sudden, unexpected death of actor Bill Paxton , there's more bad news to convey: Game of Thrones actor Neil Fingleton has died of heart failure. 
He was only 36 years old. 
Related: Dan Aykroyd Pens Touching Tribute To Ex Carrie Fisher 
According to TMZ , Fingleton — a 7'7" actor and one of the tallest men in the world — died of heart failure suddenly. He was SO young. 
The actor had starred on Game of Thrones , but he was also a college and professional basketball player before he turned to acting, playing both in the United States (at the University of North Carolina , as well as Holy Cross ), and then professionally in Spain, China, Italy, Greece, and England. 
As an actor, he had also appeared in Dr. Who , and X-Men: First Class . 
Our thoughts and prayers are with his family, friends, and loved ones. 
R.I.P.
